column1: '''Philip Frankley''' (born in [[1932]]) was a member of the [[Notion Club]].

Frankley was a poet, at one time well-known as a leader of the Queer Metre movement. He is said to have suffered from ''"horror borealis"'' - intolerance of all things Northern or Germanic, but nonetheless was a close friend of [[Alwin Arundel Lowdham
column2: Lowdham]] whose chief interest lay in the [[Anglo-Saxon]] language and history.<ref>{{SD
Guildford]] he regards any knowledge of his own language at any period before the [[wikipedia:Battle of Bosworth Field
column3: Battle of Bosworth]] as a misdemeanour.<ref>{{SD

column1: During one of the meetings of The Notion Club, he recited the poem ''[[Imram]] (The Death of [[Saint Brendan]])'' before the other members. He said that it came to him, more or less complete, in his dream.<ref>{{SD
